states.name: Alabama
states.cmeDetails: 25 AMA PRA Category 1 credits per year. At least 12.5 must be live activities. Must include 2 hours of controlled substances prescribing.
steps: Complete 25 hours of AMA PRA Category 1 CME credits
Log into the ALBME online portal and complete the renewal application
Attest to CME compliance and answer practice questions
pitfalls: Alabama requires annual renewal, not biennial like most states
At least half of CME credits must be from live, in-person activities
Failure to renew by January 1 results in automatic license lapse

faqs.question: How often do I need to renew my Alabama medical license?
faqs.answer: Alabama requires annual renewal. Your license must be renewed by January 1 each year.

faqs.question: Can I complete all my CME online in Alabama?
faqs.answer: No. At least 12.5 of the required 25 CME hours must be from live, in-person activities.

faqs.question: What happens if I miss the Alabama renewal deadline?
faqs.answer: If you fail to renew by January 1, your license lapses automatically. You may need to apply for reinstatement and pay additional fees.

faqs.question: How many CME hours does Alaska require?

faqs.answer: Yes, Alaska offers online renewal through their licensing portal.

faqs.answer: Arizona medical licenses must be renewed every two years (biennial).

faqs.answer: Yes, the Arizona Medical Board offers online renewal.

pitfalls: [RESEARCH NEEDED] Specific pitfalls for Arkansas license renewal

faqs.answer: Arkansas requires annual license renewal.

faqs.question: How many CME hours does Arkansas require?
faqs.answer: [RESEARCH NEEDED] Approximately 20 hours of CME per year.

faqs.answer: Yes, online renewal is available through the Arkansas State Medical Board.

states.name: California
states.cmeDetails: 50 hours of approved CME per biennial renewal cycle. Must include a one-time course in pain management and treatment of terminally ill patients (12 CME hours). CME verified through ACCME's PARS system.
steps: Complete 50 hours of approved CME through ACCME-accredited providers
Ensure completion of one-time pain management/end-of-life care course (12 hours)
Log into the BreEZe online portal to begin your renewal application
Verify CME credits are reported in ACCME PARS system
Pay the $1,206 biennial renewal fee and submit your application
pitfalls: California has one of the highest renewal fees in the nation at $1,206 biennially
The one-time pain management/terminally ill course (12 hours) catches first-time renewers off guard
Renewals after June 30, 2025 must be submitted online through BreEZe -- paper applications no longer accepted
CME must be verified through ACCME PARS, so ensure your providers report to that system

faqs.question: How much does it cost to renew my California medical license?
faqs.answer: The total biennial renewal fee is $1,206, which includes the base fee of $1,151 plus mandatory assessments for the Steven M. Thompson Program ($25) and CURES ($30).

faqs.question: How many CME hours do I need for California license renewal?
faqs.answer: You need 50 hours of approved CME per biennial renewal cycle. Additionally, there is a one-time requirement to complete 12 hours of training in pain management and treatment of terminally ill patients.

faqs.question: Can I renew my California medical license online?
faqs.answer: Yes. For licenses expiring on or after June 30, 2025, the Board requires all renewals to be submitted online through the BreEZe portal.

faqs.question: What happens if I let my California medical license expire?
faqs.answer: If your license expires, you cannot practice medicine in California. You will need to apply for license restoration, which may include additional fees, a review of your practice history, and potentially retaking exams if your license has been expired for an extended period.

states.name: Florida
states.cmeDetails: 40 hours of CME per biennial cycle. Must include 2 hours Prevention of Medical Errors (every cycle), 2 hours Prescribing Controlled Substances (if DEA-registered), and 2 hours Domestic Violence (every third renewal). First-time renewers only need specific mandatory courses.
states.renewalMonth: January 31 (odd or even years by group)
steps: Complete 40 hours of approved CME including all mandatory topic courses
Ensure mandatory courses are reported in CE Broker before applying
Log into the Florida Department of Health online portal
Complete the renewal application and answer professional conduct questions
Pay the $379 active renewal fee and submit
pitfalls: All CME must be tracked and reported through CE Broker before you can submit your renewal
The 2-hour Prevention of Medical Errors course is required every single renewal cycle
Domestic Violence training is required every third renewal -- easy to lose track of the schedule
Group 1 and Group 2 licenses expire on different dates, so confirm your group assignment

faqs.question: How much does it cost to renew my Florida medical license?
faqs.answer: The active license renewal fee is $379. Inactive status renewal is $149.

faqs.question: How many CME hours do I need for Florida license renewal?
faqs.answer: You need 40 hours of CME per biennial cycle. This must include 2 hours of Prevention of Medical Errors and 2 hours of Prescribing Controlled Substances (if DEA-registered). Domestic Violence training (2 hours) is required every third renewal cycle.

faqs.question: What is CE Broker and do I need it?
faqs.answer: CE Broker is Florida's electronic CME tracking system. All your continuing education must be documented in CE Broker before you can submit your renewal application. Many approved providers report directly, but you should verify your credits appear in the system.

faqs.question: When does my Florida medical license expire?
faqs.answer: Florida uses a biennial cycle. Group 1 licenses expire January 31 of even years, and Group 2 licenses expire January 31 of odd years. Check your license for your group assignment.

states.name: New York
states.boardName: New York State Education Department (NYSED) Office of the Professions
states.cmeDetails: New York does not require a specific number of CME hours for license renewal. However, physicians must complete mandatory training in infection control and barrier precautions every 4 years, child abuse identification and reporting (one-time, 2 hours), and pain management/opioid prescribing (3 hours every 3 years for controlled substance prescribers).
steps: Complete all mandatory training requirements (infection control, child abuse, pain management)
Access the NYSED Online Services portal for license renewal
Complete the renewal application and answer professional conduct questions
pitfalls: New York does not require general CME hours, but has multiple specific mandatory training requirements that are easy to overlook
The $600 biennial fee is one of the highest in the country
Infection control training must be renewed every 4 years, not every 2 years with the license -- easy to lose track
DEA-registered practitioners have additional one-time 8-hour training requirement on substance use disorders

faqs.question: Does New York require CME for medical license renewal?
faqs.answer: New York does not mandate a specific number of CME credit hours for general license renewal. However, there are several mandatory training requirements: infection control and barrier precautions (every 4 years), child abuse identification and reporting (one-time, 2 hours), and pain management/opioid prescribing (3 hours every 3 years for controlled substance prescribers).

faqs.question: How much does it cost to renew my New York medical license?
faqs.answer: The biennial registration fee for physicians in New York is $600, making it one of the highest renewal fees in the country.

faqs.question: Can I renew my New York medical license online?
faqs.answer: Yes, New York offers online renewal through the NYSED Online Services portal. You will need to complete the application, answer professional conduct questions, and pay the fee electronically.

faqs.question: What is the infection control training requirement in New York?
faqs.answer: All physicians must complete infection control and barrier precautions training every four years. This is separate from the biennial license renewal cycle, so you need to track this requirement independently.

states.name: Pennsylvania
states.cmeDetails: 100 credit hours per biennial cycle. Must include 12 credits in patient safety or risk management, 2 credits in mandated child abuse recognition and reporting (DHS-approved), and 2 credits in pain management, addiction identification, or opioid prescribing practices.
steps: Complete 100 hours of CME including all mandatory topic requirements
Ensure completion of 12 hours in patient safety/risk management
Complete DHS-approved 2-hour child abuse recognition and reporting course
Log into the Pennsylvania Licensing System (PALS) and complete the renewal application
Pay the $360 biennial renewal fee and submit
pitfalls: Pennsylvania requires 100 CME hours biennially -- one of the highest requirements in the nation
The 12-hour patient safety/risk management requirement is a significant portion that must be specifically categorized
The child abuse course must be approved by the Pennsylvania Department of Human Services (DHS), not just any provider
MDs and DOs have different renewal deadlines -- MDs by December 31, DOs by October 31

faqs.question: How many CME hours does Pennsylvania require for medical license renewal?
faqs.answer: Pennsylvania requires 100 credit hours per biennial renewal period. This includes 12 hours in patient safety or risk management, 2 hours in mandated child abuse recognition and reporting, and 2 hours in pain management, addiction identification, or opioid prescribing.

faqs.question: How much does it cost to renew my Pennsylvania medical license?
faqs.answer: The biennial renewal fee for MDs is $360. DOs pay $450. These fees may be updated periodically by the State Board of Medicine.

faqs.question: When does my Pennsylvania medical license expire?
faqs.answer: For MDs, the license cycle runs from January 1 of odd years through December 31 of the following even year. You must renew by December 31 of the even year. For DOs, the deadline is October 31 of even years.

faqs.question: What happens if I don't complete my CME by the renewal deadline?
faqs.answer: If you fail to complete the required 100 CME hours by your renewal deadline, you cannot renew your license. Practicing without a valid license is a violation of Pennsylvania law and may result in disciplinary action and additional fees for reinstatement.

states.name: Texas
states.cmeDetails: 48 CME credits per 24-month biennial registration period. At least 24 must be formal Category 1 or 1A courses. Beginning September 1, 2026, physicians performing forensic exams on sexual assault survivors must complete 2 hours of CME in forensic evidence collection. All CME verified through CE Broker.
steps: Complete 48 hours of CME credits with at least 24 in formal Category 1/1A courses
Ensure all CME is reported and verifiable in CE Broker
Log into the Texas Medical Board online portal and begin your renewal application
Complete the biennial registration form and answer practice questions
Pay the $491 biennial registration fee and submit
pitfalls: At least half of your 48 CME credits must be in formal Category 1 or 1A courses -- informal credits alone won't suffice
TMB verifies CME compliance through CE Broker; if your credits aren't in the system, you cannot renew
The 24-month CME timeline is tied to your registration period, not the calendar year
New forensic evidence collection CME requirement takes effect September 1, 2026 for qualifying physicians

faqs.question: How many CME hours does Texas require for medical license renewal?
faqs.answer: Texas requires 48 CME credits per 24-month biennial registration period. At least 24 of those credits must be in formal, Category 1 or 1A courses.

faqs.question: How much does it cost to renew my Texas medical license?
faqs.answer: The total biennial registration fee is approximately $491, which includes the TMB base fee ($370), Senate Bill 104 fee ($80), Prescription Monitoring Program fee ($11.48), National Practitioner Data Bank fee ($21), Physician Health Program fee ($7), and Office of Patient Protection fee ($2).

faqs.question: What is CE Broker and why does it matter for Texas renewal?
faqs.answer: CE Broker is the electronic system the Texas Medical Board uses to verify CME compliance. If your completed CME credits are not reported in CE Broker, the TMB cannot verify compliance and you will be unable to renew your license.

faqs.question: Can I complete all my Texas CME online?
faqs.answer: You can complete some credits online, but at least 24 of your 48 required credits must be in formal, Category 1 or 1A courses. Check with your CME provider to confirm their courses meet TMB formal category requirements.
